<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;A&quot; is an alias for a different flag. For most clients it&#39;s more convenient</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if this function returns unaliased Args, so create an unaliased arg for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// returning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This creates a completely new Arg object for the unaliased Arg because</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the alias and the unaliased arg can have different Kinds and different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Values (due to AliasArgs&lt;&gt;).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Get the spelling from the unaliased option.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> UnaliasedSpelling = Args.MakeArgString(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a>(UnaliasedOption.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/option/#a6604b3e1abb2089b8fb2e1880a92daa6">getPrefix</a>()) + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a>(UnaliasedOption.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/option/#acc97061b780820c39cc4afd878aec21b">getName</a>()));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s a bit weird that aliased and unaliased arg share one index, but</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the index is mostly use as a memory optimization in render().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Due to this, ArgList::getArgString(A-&gt;getIndex()) will return the spelling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the aliased arg always, while A-&gt;getSpelling() returns either the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unaliased or the aliased arg, depending on which Arg object it&#39;s called on.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UnaliasedA =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::make&#95;unique&lt;Arg&gt;(UnaliasedOption, UnaliasedSpelling, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>-&gt;getIndex());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> &#42;RawA = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.get();</Highlight></CodeLine>
